text: The Brazil nut (Bertholletia excelsa) is a tree from the family Lecythidaceae. It is native to South America. The trees are known for their nuts that come from the fruit of the plant. ==The plant== The Brazil nut is known to be a large tree in the Amazon rainforest. It can be about tall and the diameter of its trunk is about . It could live for 500 years. Some trees could also reach a thousand years of age. The stem is straight and commonly does not have branches in half of itself. ==References== Category:Ericales Category:Edible nuts and seeds
title: Brazil nut
